issues.description: The template and solution differ in the return type of Stock.getStockIngredients(): the template provides public List<StockIngredient> getStockIngredients() while the solution provides public StockIngredient[] getStockIngredients(). The problem statement's UML lists Stock operations but does not specify this getter signature, so students starting from the template will see a List-returning getter, while the reference solution uses an array. This inconsistency in the type returned by the getter may confuse students about which type to use when interacting with Stock and can lead to minor integration friction or compile-time mismatches if they follow one artifact and compare to the other.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the getter signature for stock ingredients across template and solution. Either change the template's getStockIngredients() to return StockIngredient[] (and return this.stockIngredients) or change the solution's getter to return List<StockIngredient> (e.g., Arrays.asList(this.stockIngredients)). This alignment prevents confusion and ensures students see a consistent API in both starter code and reference solution.
